revised_title: Theoretical Analysis of Diffuse Scattering of X-rays by Crystals
tldr: The author presents an elementary derivation of the Faxen-Waller formula for the diffuse scattering of X-rays by thermally excited lattice vibrations and the shapes of the surfaces of isodiffusion in reciprocal space for cubic crystals. The theory is illustrated by calculations made for a single crystal of sodium. The author discusses the differences in shape between surfaces belonging to different lattice planes and the potential of this phenomenon to be developed into a method of determining the elastic constants of crystals.
